stories.Title: Not with my data!
stories.Description: While some media outlets embrace AI and reach agreements for data leverage, others are less enthused. The New York Times is suing OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement.
stories.Tweet: Not with my data! 📦 While some media outlets embrace AI and reach agreements for data leverage, others are less enthused. The New York Times is suing OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement. #ai https://www.theverge.com/2023/12/27/24016212/new-york-times-openai-microsoft-lawsuit-copyright-infringement

stories.Title: Keep it to yourself
stories.Description: Sharing personal thoughts with ChatGPT might seem tempting when there's no one else to talk to, but recent research warns against it due to potential privacy vulnerabilities in the chatbot.
stories.Tweet: Keep it to yourself 📦 Sharing personal thoughts with ChatGPT might seem tempting when there's no one else to talk to, but recent research warns against it due to potential privacy vulnerabilities in the chatbot. #ai https://interestingengineering.com/culture/chatgpt-private-information-raises-concerns

stories.Title: The next big thing
stories.Description: Sam Altman is working on developing a hardware device powered by OpenAI's innovation. The specifics are yet unknown, even to him, but a growing number of former Apple minds are joining his team.
stories.Tweet: The next big thing 📦 Sam Altman is working on developing a hardware device powered by OpenAI's innovation. The specifics are yet unknown, even to him, but a growing number of former Apple minds are joining his team. #ai https://gizmodo.com/jony-ive-poaches-lead-iphone-designer-to-work-on-openai-1851125927

stories.Title: Big moves by big players
stories.Description: As AI continues to disrupt the tech landscape, it seems that major companies are taking the lead when it comes to investing in AI startups, surpassing conventional investors.
stories.Tweet: Big moves by big players 📦 As AI continues to disrupt the tech landscape, it seems that major companies are taking the lead when it comes to investing in AI startups, surpassing conventional investors. #ai https://arstechnica.com/ai/2023/12/big-tech-is-spending-more-than-vc-firms-on-ai-startups/

stories.Title: A real smart place
stories.Description: Your kitchen may have missed the AI touch, but don't worry—Samsung Electronics is here to help with the Bespoke 4-Door Flex Refrigerator, featuring "Vision AI" technology to recognize food items.
stories.Tweet: A real smart place 📦 Your kitchen may have missed the AI touch, but don't worry—Samsung Electronics is here to help with the Bespoke 4-Door Flex Refrigerator, featuring "Vision AI" technology to recognize food items. #ai https://www.techtimes.com/articles/300090/20231227/samsung-unveil-new-ai-powered-kitchen-products-applications-ces-2024.htm

stories.Title: Is it or isn't it?
stories.Description: The astronomy community has debated for years: Are the objects around Kepler-1625b and Kepler-1708b really exomoons? Due to the lack of data, assessing their validity is difficult.
stories.Tweet: Is it or isn't it? 📦 The astronomy community has debated for years: Are the objects around Kepler-1625b and Kepler-1708b really exomoons? Due to the lack of data, assessing their validity is difficult. #science https://arstechnica.com/science/2023/12/more-doubts-raised-over-exomoon-candidates/

stories.Title: Just here to help
stories.Description: In the era of humanoid robots, workplace concerns grow. Agility Robotics and Apptronik, leading companies in this tech, emphasize their goal: to amplify human capabilities, not replace them.
stories.Tweet: Just here to help 📦 In the era of humanoid robots, workplace concerns grow. stories.Title: Best of luck
stories.Description: After multiple delays that have forced a complete adjustment of all its scheduled flights, SpaceX's Falcon Heavy will try again to launch the X-37B space plane for the U.S. Space Force tomorrow.
stories.Tweet: Best of luck 📦 After multiple delays that have forced a complete adjustment of all its scheduled flights, SpaceX's Falcon Heavy will try again to launch the X-37B space plane for the U.S. Space Force tomorrow. #spacex https://www.space.com/spacex-space-force-x-37b-ot7-launch-webcast

stories.Title: No watches for a while
stories.Description: If you still haven't caught up with all the circumstances around Apple's sales ban on the Apple Watch, there's a comprehensive timeline to clear all doubts.

stories.Title: Possible new look
stories.Description: Tesla may surprise us in the upcoming months, as reports suggest the automaker is preparing a Model Y refresh, drawing inspiration from the latest Model 3 upgrades.
stories.Tweet: Possible new look 📦 Tesla may surprise us in the upcoming months, as reports suggest the automaker is preparing a Model Y refresh, drawing inspiration from the latest Model 3 upgrades. #tesla https://electrek.co/2023/12/27/tesla-model-y-refresh-coming-months-report-says/

title: OpenAI's copyright infringement, Sam Altman's mystery hardware, SpaceX tries again
description: Uh oh, OpenAI and Microsoft have gotten into hot water with The New York Times, accused of using the media giant's publications to train their AI models. Sam Altman is all hyped about dropping a groundbreaking AI hardware device, and though there's little information on it, he's got an A-team backing him up (some might be ex-Apple folks). Lastly, SpaceX is gearing up to launch the X-37B space plane tomorrow—fingers crossed it all goes smoothly 'cause the January flight schedule's already packed!
